title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL)
Interview Descriptions: 1. Phone Interview 2. Three-person interview After, they let you know after seven business days if you got the job. It was not challenging, but a lot of pressure since three people were interviewing.
Interview Questions: 1. Tell me about yourself? 2. What makes you different from everyone else

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute interview. Asked questions about my life. Why I want to work there, why this specific concentration, what I want to do long term. The interview was basically to get to know me. I was then given the chance to ask some questions back. The interviewees were extremely friendly, I was able to have a normal conversation with them.
Interview Questions: Asked questions about my life. Why I want to work there, why this specific concentration, what I want to do long term. The interview was basically to get to know me. I was then given the chance to ask some questions back. The interviewees were extremely friendly, I was able to have a normal conversation with them.

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Not a quick process, took some time to get contacted after I submitted my resume. Once I got the first call and interview, it moved somehow quickly, however the final answer came a while after the final interview
Interview Questions: What differentiates you from the other candidates?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Process took over a month with 4 rounds of interviews, 1st round was a virtual interview, next 3 rounds were on campus. The hiring manager was very transparent with timelines and expectations.
Interview Questions: How would you handle situations coming on board within the 1st 90 days?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: Good Experience with all benfits a studnet can expect with a College Orginization Like FIU so they asks all the skills and required criteria and thats it all the best
Interview Questions: Skills for Subject Required for job

title: Membership Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy process, scheduled an in-person interview with simple basic questions you’d expect and got back an update the following week. very friendly and straight forward, dress accordingly even if you are a student
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: System Administrator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview with hiring manager and team. Asked many technical questions and culture fit. People were very nice but it took long to get called after applying. Overall good experience.
Interview Questions: Describe a conflict with a coworker and how you resolved the issue?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: Easy. Took less than 15 minutes. One round. Via zoom at the time. It was pretty quick and got an offer on the spot. Working for the department is great but if you work in anyway with some of the resources that students use you may find some issues with management.
Interview Questions: 5 year plan, goals, research experience.

title: Peer Career Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview process. They asked all the typical questions, "Tell us about yourself, what are your strengths & weaknesses, what experience do you have, etc. The people who work at FIU are very kind and want you to do well.
Interview Questions: "Tell us about yourself, what are your strengths & weaknesses, etc

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: good and succinct. it only required one round of interviews and a lot of the questions were non-technical. So a very easy process for the most part. good and succinct. it only required one round of interviews and a lot of the questions were non-technical. So a very easy process for the most part.
Interview Questions: Can you code on python?

title: Student Account Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Florida International University in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Waited a month to schedule an interview after submitting an application. The interview had six people asking a variety of questions. Approx. 45 minutes long. Took three months to receive a decision email.
Interview Questions: Short and long term goals?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: Mostly behavioral analysis questions. Very standard for your average interview. Most of the questions relate back to asking how you would solve individual conflicts between people, and your style of addressing situations.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to solve a dispute between friends.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: An all-day interview with numerous administrators and instructors from the school that asked questions about community, experience, and vision, including a demo teach that incorporated a reflection. A nice conversation about diversity, equity, and inclusion too.
Interview Questions: Q: Why would you like to be a part of the FIU community?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: After I was selected for an interview, I had my interview over Zoom due to the fact that some interviewees couldn't make it in person. The process was relatively smooth, quick, and easy.
Interview Questions: If you could describe yourself in one word, what word would it be?

title: Resident Assistant (RA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of personality and situational questions. Challenging but it is doable. It is important to prepare beforehand even if that is with a friend. Being yourself helps a lot.
Interview Questions: Not word for word but if you had a situation with a friend going against policy and you’re aware, how would you handle it?

title: Resident Assistant (RA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL)
Interview Descriptions: The interview is mostly focused on explaining your strengths. Also, your experience in stressful situations in the past, leadership qualities, and how would the company benefit from having you on the team.
Interview Questions: our experience in stressful situations in the past

title: Fiu Online Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: One group interview with about three other people. Not very difficult, just be yourself. They are just looking for someone who is capable of learning quickly and talking to clients.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with a traditional one-hour long group onsite interview. I was invited back for a second half-day interview involving multiple departments. Afterwards, I was asked to complete a written assignment related to the job.
Interview Questions: What kind of work environment do you thrive in?

title: Foundation Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions:
Pretty lame process with the FIU Foundation. First few calls went well, often 2-4 week gaps with no communication, then proceeded to a final round panel where I was asked things like how do I belong in the local community not being from FL. Didn't sound like an inclusive question to me. 
After that, a few emails back and forth then was completely ghosted. Never even got a rejection email. If this is how they hire candidates, I wouldn't want to work there.
Interview Questions: What is your work management style

title: Assistant Director of Campus Life Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida International University in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: 3 hour long interview. Took them until the last interview to actually tell me more details about the job description. Students, different teams, and supervisors were all included. Did not talk about salary or next steps.
Interview Questions: Q: How will this job help you reach your future career goals?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: Fun and productive. I think the only thing was how tedious it felt to have everyone in one place. I guess it just works out for them to organize it like that but be ready to see your competition.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you saw a friend breaking policy.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with lab members and lead PI of group. Discussed job responsibilities and answered questions about my relevant experience. Two rounds, first over the phone and second via Zoom. Everyone was very friendly throughout.
Interview Questions: How did you troubleshoot a problem?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
I applied and was contacted about 2 weeks later. I have contacted HR Talent Acquisitions every few days to see the progress of my application. The Director of Operational Analysis reached out to me on Friday to set an interview day on the following Tuesday. 

My expectations that it would be a one on one interview, however it was with a panel of 5 people specializing in different areas of research in that particular office.
Interview Questions: What do you enjoy most about doing research?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: I emailed  to the professor.His research matches with my research.He responded to my email and interview Ed me . Finally I was able to join his lab. Yes asked me technical questions
Interview Questions: Why you want to do research

title: Content Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The hiring staff was very courteous and easy-going throughout the interview process. They wanted to know what my thought process is for creating and strategizing content for a company. They assured me of what they were looking for and what benefits they provided to their employees.
Interview Questions: Q: How would you improve the current content we post on our social media platforms?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Questioned about management skills and previous work history-related job experience. How do you handle stressful situations or tight deadlines? What do you hope to gain from working as a student assistant, and how does it align with your future goals
Interview Questions: What strategies do you use to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: Great people who really put together a thoughtful review process. Would highly recommend applying here if you’re a student because you’ll benefit greatly and have access to plenty of support systems along the way.
Interview Questions: Questions were more through conversation.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions:
Write small paper

Listen for details of a project or challenge where the candidate showed competence and initiative, even if they weren’t ultimately successful. A great answer will include specifics of a quantifiable outcome or result from a successful experience or valuable insights and strategy improvements from a meaningful failure.

Industry-specific problem-solving skills
Creativity and initiative
Self awareness and an accurate appraisal of business value

Three interviews.

One with program director
One with department chair
One with college dean
Interview Questions:
Relevant experience and training
Understanding of the position applied for
Consistent, purposeful pursuit of endeavors within the industry

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I was interviewed online. Overall, it was a positive experience for me. I really enjoyed talking to my advisor. The interview was pretty easy and the key is to relax and be yourself.
Interview Questions: If you had a difficult time with a member in a group, how did you solve the issue.

title: Student Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: A graduate student asked questions to get to know my personality and my work experience. It was over a zoom meeting and wore a professional outfit. THey asked why I wanted to be a part of this internship and answered truthfully.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to join this internship?

title: Federal Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: Streamline and flexible to your schedule. They make sure you're enrolled as a student and making time for your studies. Make sure you have a plan when interviewing to see your time management
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here.

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: It was a little intimidating. Professors are very competent and motivational. Two professors interviewed me for about 45 minutes. I got a reply shortly after with a job offer and lots of feedback.
Interview Questions: How have you contributed to science?

title: Data Entry Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth. They respond to several questions and work with you all the steps until you are hired. They require a presentation to have an idea how well you are.
Interview Questions: The experience related to the job

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: GRE needs to be 304 plus. I saw people with 304, 305 gre score. I saw few 330. Subject needs to match. Previous experience with research field is a plus.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your work experience?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: To the point and interested in personal skills as well as hands on management of information as a priority. They're looking for students who have an availability and are looking to hone their office skills as well as their interactions with other students.
Interview Questions:
How do you value privacy?

What is a situation where you had to confront a superior?How did you resolve it?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: Invited to a zoom meeting with several directors on a research position and asked about my projects and experience. Very casual and easy meeting. However, the process to be hired was long and tedious.
Interview Questions: About my projects and of my experience

title: Computer Programmer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: Direct and great for someone who wants to start in this line of work.  Several Campus options help expand exposure.  Great for students just starting out or living on campus.
Interview Questions: Are you a computer science major

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: The process was made to test one's ability to solve problems, coordinate with other staff, and instruct those that work under you. The interview was about 2 hours and has a
Interview Questions:
Do you know any scripting languages?
Are comfortable in working in an environment with students?
Do you have any computer hardware and software skills?
Have you every lend a team?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process, complete set of questions. Quick response after the interview as well. Was a nice experience overall. Would highly recommend applying to the various roles they have. I worked for the graduate admissions office. They also arranged stay, food etc.
Interview Questions: General resume questions and behaviroal

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: There are two round in this interview process. The first round is usually taking place with one current Resident Assistant and a Resident Life Coordinator/ Assistant Resident Life Coordinator. The second round is grouped to see how you work within a team.
Interview Questions: Can you tell us about an issue that current college students are facing?

title: Private Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: very good. The people there are very nice, they truly want to learn form you and you have to get to know them as well. It's truly a great experience and one of the nicest processes of interview. You will be treated very well and with a lot of respect. The culture there is like a family.
Interview Questions: What's your experience in tutoring?

title: Membership Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was well and I was kept in touch with every step of the way. Everything was during covid so it was quite easy to do the background check and meeting with everyone was awesome because they were all super nice.
Interview Questions: If you could describe yourself as any gym equipment, what would you be?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions:
One 45-minute interview over Zoom with two Directors. I was asked 2-3 questions. One of the Directors  didn’t really seem to be paying attention during my responses, and they have been ghosting me ever since (4+ weeks), which is incredibly unprofessional. It is possible that it’s taking FIU this long to make a decision, but if that is the case, the professional thing to do would be to respond to one of my emails explaining the timeline. 

Ghosting should be reserved for startup companies, who don’t know any better, and teenage girls. For an established university to do this is insulting.
Interview Questions: Describe your current role and responsibilities.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Zoom call, preceded by a conversation through Emails. It was with a specific professor, so questions were related to classes previously taken and interest in the field. Specifically, related to the field of Cyber Security and protection against hacking.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with Cyber-Security related software.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: They ask about your experience in the field. They show you the facility and the equipment to be used in the lab. Then you’re introduced to your possible teammates and managers.
Interview Questions: What’s your most recent research experience?

title: Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: You are asked a series of questions about why you like the position, what they can fofee you, what you can offer them. What you would bring to the table as a menotr . What is something you would like to focus on in your time in FIU as a mentor?
Interview Questions: What is something you would like to focus on in your time in FIU as a mentor?

title: Grad Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Pretty lax and transparent. Within about three weeks I knew the office that was interested in hiring me. I had an overall fairly easy but standard interview that didn't exceed half an hour.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me a bit about yourself.

title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was very informative and not too difficult. they made sure I was not feeling nervous at all and also were very considerate of my concerns. I am very proud I gave them a chance and I would do it again.
Interview Questions: How was my Experience before fiu

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Dallas, TX) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: After application, I was scheduled for a  Skype interview  after 2 weeks. All the lab members were present in the panel for the Skype interview and the interview lasted for nearly 45 minutes
Interview Questions: My project work, skills and my experience

title: Student Computer Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: they just asked the basic interview questions such as "what happens if my internet goes out", "what is DHCP", what happens if my printer can't print, "do you know how to install windows 10"
Interview Questions: Do you know how to install windows 10

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a mix of technical and personality questions and was conducted by one person. The questions were not overly complex, and the interview felt both comfortable and professional.
Interview Questions: How do you approach dealing with difficult people?

title: Environmental Programs Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: The entire hiring process takes a while, but once you get through the interview and paperwork it's a breeze. Although I did have to be determined about getting the position and actively went out of my way to follow up on the process, to show that I was highly interested in working for the department I applied under.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you worked on a team-based project and a member was not doing their share of the work, how did you handle it?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida International University in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: They allow you to describe yourself to them. Personality, work ethic, skills. Try to remain on topic and avoid sounding egotistic. Overall, it was a fair experience. They explain the position, just in case you may try to change your mind.
Interview Questions: Why don't you tell me about yourself?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: It was a student position so much wasn't required at the time. You just have to be reliable and demonstrate dedication.  It was a one on one interview. The most relaxing interview I had and I wasn't nervous.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Campus Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Usually a panel of 3-4 people that will all take turns asking you some pretty basic questions. You need to have a basic knowledge of FIU buildings and programs. Some scenario questions.
Interview Questions: They will ask a few questions about scenarios that could pop up on tour.

title: Nursing Student RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Besides all the basic requirements, FIU requires a video interview. Not like a zoom call. More like you presenting yourself and your resume to a camera and sending it. I noticed that "video skills" required are pretty basic. I had a professional record and edit mines but some just used their phone. As long as they can clearly see and hear you, your video will be accepted.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years? Why nursing? What is an obstacle you've faced in your life?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: The process was long. I applied in April and was called for an interview at the end of March. I was only asked to come in for one interview with the Director. Was offered a position in June.
Interview Questions: What do you know about our office?

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Overall, it was a very easy process. Very typical interview questions about yourself. I had a phone call asking if I was interested and then scheduled a 1:1 interview. I interviewed with two people from the department for around 30 minutes. I was told I would get a phone call following up on the interview and a couple hours later I was given the offer.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict?

title: One Stop Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, took around a month to contact me, put a date por an interview, went to the interview that day. Five people asking questions. Really nice some of them. Same questions I've gotten in previous interviews at FIU
Interview Questions: Weaknesses and strengths

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: apply months ahead of position, and background check, drug check, and make sure all the paperwork is submitted ahead of time. Then once the approve, you can pick what rotations you would like and apply for that and what date you would like to start the rotations.
Interview Questions: what is status of citizenship or need to take visa?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: Send your resume to the proper person who his/her major and works are in line with you. Then, he will ask you some more questions depends on your resume. Finally, a personal or skype interview.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: short and pretty straightforward Interviews with 3 people who asked about my customer service skills short and pretty straightforward Interviews with 3 people who asked about my customer service skills
Interview Questions: short and pretty straightforward Interviews with 3 people who asked about my customer service skills

title: Benefits Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The assistant called me and asked some questions. Then we fixed an interview time.  The assistant professor asked me about 15 questions. Nice smile and answer. But they didn't give some feedback.
Interview Questions: If you made some mistakes and the employee angry about you, what will you do?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida International University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a good interview process, day full of meeting faculty with lunch and breaks in between. The overall process was seamless and group interviews. It was a good interview process, day full of meeting faculty with lunch and breaks in between. The overall process was seamless and group interviews.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: They took a while to answer back but I was interviewed once and got the job 2 weeks later. It went well though, very friendly people. Would recommend working here to anyone
Interview Questions: Why would you make a good candidate?

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Casual but professional.  The individual who conducted the interview was the supervisor of the math lab. Asked general questions like my math course history and grades and if I had any prior work experience.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with students?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews in total.  One with the panel and the last one with the department manager, Panel presented scenarios that I had to respond to.  Took a typing test. The final interview was with department manager.  Pretty standards.  Spoke about position and expectations.
Interview Questions: Gave a scenario with an upset prospect.  How would you handle it?

title: Marketing Assistant College of Business Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: They did super Short questions, then they made me walk through my resume, everything was super nice and chill. The people who interviewed me were super nice and I loved the experience, it was great.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience at event planning

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone interview 
2. In person with 4 staff members 
3. Director interview if selected 

Overall friendly staff and good interview experience although I do not like behavioral type questions and feel it's not a for sure way to select the "best" candidate.
Interview Questions: Behavioral type questions. Tell me about a time when...

title: Student Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was face-to-face. She was very nice.  She asked about my background, what time I was available. She explained about the job position if I had some experience mentoring.
Interview Questions: TEll me about your background

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Spoke to lab head about my experience. Wanted to know if my knowledge was related to what the lab was doing. Then discussed possible projects I could work on.
Interview Questions: What kind of work have you done and how is it related to the research we are doing

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Skype meeting with six faculty members. Talking about my research and teaching skills, funding sources and amounts, plans for the future regarding research and teaching and applying for grants. Visiting campus and meeting the vice president for research.
Interview Questions: Why did not you include the amounts for your grants in your resume?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process went pretty well. The panel was made up of three people, so go in expecting a panel of three people or two panels of two. I applied online and was told after the interview that I'd hear back in about two weeks.
Interview Questions:
Strengths and weaknesses?
What do you look for in a supervisor?
What are your long-term goals?
What interests you about this position?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple and straight forward. They explain what type of individual they are looking for in the job and what their expectations are.  It was very simple and straightforward.
Interview Questions: One of the questions I received in the interview was: "How will previous experiences help with your success in the job?"

title: Front Desk Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: fair questions and easy outgoing interview process. I felt free to ask questions and voice my overall concerns. there was only one round of interviews and I was notified quickly about the job.
Interview Questions: What are your goals and why do you want to work at this position?

title: Associate Director, Student Success and Academic Programs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Florida International University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions:
This interview was specifically for FIU's Federal Relations Office in Washington, DC. I had a first round phone interview on a federal holiday, MLK Jr. Day, as I was told this would facilitate the hiring process. This was a mostly positive experience, and it was followed by a second round in-person interview on site, for which I'm local and luckily didn't have to travel. This experience was overall pleasant, if not unorganized, and I thoroughly enjoyed meeting the staff and students. I was then informed that there would be a third round interview for those progressing. This is where the process becomes rather murky. 

I followed up with my interviewers 6 weeks after the interview, and I received no response. I understand this is common practice, but the position remained open until the new fiscal year began on July 3, when it was reposted. I was notified of the rejection the same day the job was reopened, which is a highly questionable practice. 

Further, I received a general form letter, a practice more common in pre-screening candidates than second round interviews. I am not concerned about the rejection, but I attempted to explain my concerns about the lack of professionalism and transparency, especially after a four-month silence. The recruiter told me her understanding was that that I had been informed, and that her notice was an "informal notification to close the hiring process." This is absurd coming from the HR department writing from an official university email account. I tried contacting the HR Office on campus to express my concerns, but I was redirected back to the recruiter. I've been in higher education for over a decade and have advanced degrees. This was the most unprofessional experience I've had, and I'm used to bureaucratic procedures. My sense is that they're really unclear about what they want from this position, or they were holding out for a specific hire.
Interview Questions: How would you promote our specialty masters courses?

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of three stages. A written application, a group workshop where they assess how you interact with other people in a group, and a one on one interview.
Interview Questions: How would you describe perseverance?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions:
I was extremely excited to have received a call to schedule an interview. The only problem is that I was told I could only come Monday at 11am and I have no other option. which I thought sounded odd all in its self to have no options available. I received the call on a Friday morning and was asked to come in the following Monday and to also have a 5 to 10 min. presentation ready to present, which I have no problem with but the lack of flexibility when it came to scheduling my interview is the main issue.

Needless to say I won’t be able to make the interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Just talk to the professor that wants to hire you. There's nothing really to it. If the professor knows you and you did well in the class you should be fine
Interview Questions: What grade did  you get in programming 1?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: It is extremely fast and easy.  You're contacted via email or phone for the first interview. The interview schedule was extremely flexible. The HR manager was extremely professional and pleasant. She explained the hiring process and answered my questions.

title: Student Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: Why would you like to work at FIU?

title: Admissions Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida International University

title: Enrollment Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL)
Interview Descriptions:
This was for FIU Online Enrollment Associate. The interview process took a month, the time it took for them to call me for an interview was over 5 months. 

It was a group interview, with 3 people conducting the interview (HR rep, two dept. managers). All interviews at FIU are done with a panel of interviewers. For this position it was quite different as they asked us to bring in an item for show and tell. I move one to a second interview with 4 other people and the same 3 interviewers. I was offered the job that same week.
Interview Questions: Interviews for other positions are straight out of an HR interview question book: situational questions; what is your biggest regret? greatest achievement? etc...

Phone call/Email is sent to you to schedule the interview.

This is telling me to say more, but this box is too stupid to understand that I cannot simplify it any more. Anybody older than 10 years old can understand this.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied in May, had a telephone interview in June, then an in person interview in July and a third interview in August. The process was unnecessarily long. I felt I did great and the interviewers liked me but in the end I didn't get the position. I had to basically harass the HR rep every week after the final interview and when I finally got an answer she was very cold and didn't give any feed back when asked. Since then I have interviewed for another position which has gone much faster and smoother but I have not heard back yet.

title: Student Assistant Interview

title: Student Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: Laid back interview more like a conversation asking about skills, interests etc. Also spoke about the position requirements, expectations and such.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL)
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to interview with a total of 8 people in a span of 2 days. It was rather unnecessary since I would only be working directly with 2 out of those 8 people. Needless to say they all went well as I had already established a good rapport with most of the interviewers due to my time volunteering for the department.
Interview Questions: What are your long term goals with research?

title: Graphic Designer - FIU Online Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Florida International University (Doral, FL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online via the FIU online portal. 65 days later I received a phone call from the FIU Online Employee Services Coordinator asking to schedule an interview that same week, but I was unable to answer it.  She left a voicemail, and she sent an email with the same information.

I replied via email and was able to schedule the interview for the following week.  There was a scheduling conflict with my schedule and the Hiring Manager's schedule.

The interview was scheduled at the MANGO Building 650, at the Modesto A. Maidique Campus, and I was told I would be meeting with the Executive Director of Marketing, Communications, & Recruitment, the Associate Director of Marketing & Communications, and the Employee Services Coordinator.

There is no FREE parking on this campus, be prepared to pay for parking using your mobile phone and the PayByPhone App.  The Building itself is fairly new and modern, there is a Starbucks and a Panda Express on the first floor.  Take the elevator behind panda express to go to the FIU Online offices (5th & 6th floor, I believe).  I was a bit early, so I had to wait a bit before the interview.  The offices looked very nice, but everyone there seemed a bit too busy to be nice and say good morning/afternoon or even acknowledge the fact that there was someone there waiting to be interviewed, which I found a bit odd and rude.

The Marketing team members came upstairs from the other floor and then were directed to the conference room where the interview would be held.  I waited a bit for that as well.  I am not sure if I was the first person being interviewed for this position or not, but I got the feeling they were not prepared to interview me.  I was also told I would be interviewing with 3 other people, who would be my superiors or the Employee Services Coordinator, so I printed 3 copies of my resume and had them ready... only to find that another person would be joining us, which would be a co-worker.  Another Graphic Designer.  I thought it was a bit odd that they would bring a co-worker to the interview.  I understand why, but I feel like after you had a few possible candidates and came for a second interview, that would be the time to introduce the co-workers, I am not sure why the other Graphic Designer was involved in the interview process.

Overall, I thought the interview had a good flowing conversational environment.  What I got from them was that they are a very small team and only recently have grown from 2 to 6-7 people.  I am not sure who they all are, but seemed like a very small operation.  They will be looking for a copyrighter and a traffic manager in the future, possibly.  They are in charge of the FIU ONLINE marketing only, and their target market are students who would take their entire degrees online, a fully online degree, graduate or undergraduate.  They just moved to that building.

They are faced paced, and have a balance of a lot of production to put out ads using templates.  But they also have some times when they can be creative and come up with new art.

They have a Monitor up where you can show your portfolio from the web, or hook up your ipad to it. And they will go through your portfolio and ask questions about each piece, if you talk about it.
Interview Questions:
1. What interested you about FIU Online or FIU and this position?
2. Could you tell us a little bit about yourself?
3. Tell us a little bit more about your work.  What is it that you do, I know you are a graphic artist, but what do you think you are good at? What are your areas of strength?

title: Enrollment Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
2 interviews, both group interviews. Both within weeks from each other. Started the position about 2 weeks after because some of the other people hired did not submit their papers on time.

The interview was with Giselle Martinez, who is probably the nicest and just overall best person ever, and two other people.

Very unconventional and fun interview, felt more like a discussion than interview. We were asked to bring in an item for "show and tell", we presented the item, then switched with anyone one of the other interviewees and "sold" their item. We were asked to name a movie we hated and explain why. Then we were asked to sell that movie. The second interview was conducted by the same people. We were told to create a presentation to sell "O" the Cirque du Soleil show.
Interview Questions: Which one of your colleagues would you choose for this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
-Met with two interviewers
- I was asked a series of questions by both 
- I was given an opportunity to ask the interviewers questions
- Given a tour of the office
- Introduced to other members of the team
- Given an idea of when they will give me their decision

Why do I think I am qualified for this job?
What unique qualities do I have that is related to the position?

title: Student Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was awesome. I had a coffee and chilled out. All the people there were very kind and treated me like family. Everybody was very polite and it was a great interview. I recommend this to everyone. It is a great work environment and you work with mostly people your own age.
Interview Questions: They asked me to be on time, do my job to the fullest, let them know if anything was wrong and if I was concerned about something personal, to let them know.

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: STP Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Filled out the application in detail, describing how I worked with children in the past. It asked a lot about the different sports I was interested in and how those skills would be able to translate to working with kids with ADHD. I sent in cover letter and resume along with 3 recommendations. After FIU received all of my information, I was emailed/called 3 weeks later. I set up an interview time and talked with the interviewer (Andrew) for around an hour and a half. (the man likes to talk) and he asked me several questions about what I had written in my application. He asked me to describe circumstances where i used problem solving skills and team-first mentality to overcome problems.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness and how can you use that to your advantage?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: simple interview, they only wanted to know why I was interested in the job. the interviewer had already spoken to the professor that referred me to find out if I was qualified.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a teaching assistant?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Straight forward interview.
Not too many technical questions as this was for a tempo role.
Why are you interested, what salary are you looking for, etc.
The explanation of the role was very simple and only required a max of 20hrs /week
Interview Questions: how do you handle upset users?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a brief phone call and an in-person panel interview. The panel consisted of 6 people including the director and associate director. Each took a turn asking me simple situational/behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida International University in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Online application was submitted, an email was later sent to me schedule an interview. It was a panel interview. I was then sent for an email with the job offer after a week. Background checks and drug testing was conducted before I was given the offer letter and scheduled for orientation and training.
Interview Questions: Research experience

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: waiting paper work so long time. the manager talk some technique problems and background check . I said some experience of fond_end application and some font_end skills, such as html5,css3,jquery and so on
Interview Questions: which  javascript library you can used? what did you use the tools of control resource?

title: R&D Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back, straightforward, and to the point. The professor and I had spoke many times prior to the formal interview, so we pretty much knew what was expected from one another.
Interview Questions: What's your major and concentrations?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was searching for a part time position and I emailed all of the professor in my department including program manager. Program manager replied that if anything comes up then she will forward my resume. then one of the professor replied that he is interested to hire me and contact with him in my prefer time. I went there and it is kind of informal interview he was taken. he just let me knew that what I need to do. if he is interested then I may work with him. And I accept the offer.
Interview Questions: Nothing that much asked which is unexpected.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview wasnt that bad. they asked questions about the classes that I took, what grades i recieved in them and how comfortable I am in Teaching them. Also they made me do a practice exam on the courses that I wanted to tutor. I passed all of them and was able to tutor Math and Science. Also had a lot of "situational " interview questions.
Interview Questions: What are you most comfortable Tutoring?

title: Data Entry Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very concise, received interview request only a few weeks following my application submission. I had only one interview process for the position applied, very professional, positive, overall very positive experience with academic employer of higher education
Interview Questions: Why was I interested in data entry position?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy, they call you. Usually just one interview. Sometimes just a phone call is enough. Really depends on the department that calls you and who the supervisor is. Some are hard some are easy. But for student assistant jobs, usually easy on the student
Interview Questions: Why FIU?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: FIU was able to accommodate my distance away from the campus by utilizing SKYPE for the interview.  I was very pleased with the process and very lucky that they were able to offer me this option to meet with the interview committee via long distance.
Interview Questions: Why FIU and Miami.

title: Research Undergraduate Experience Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: selected well academic standing students were selected. a brief interview about your interests were conducted. you are allowed to select the area you wish to work in.
Interview Questions: no complex questions

title: Librarian Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the job through the FIU career link and within a week I received an email to schedule an appointment for an Interview. The interview was in the library and right after the interview I was hired and started training for the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the library, Tell me about yourself, strengths/weakness.

title: Parking Patroller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a very pleasant experience which started on time as expected. very basic style of interview, conducty by friendly personel which made feel great throughtout the entire process. the hiring process took a little longer than expected. I had to wait around a month before i got offered the job.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with angry costumers ?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very laid back. I was only asked if I was available to work for the employer. No behavioral or complex questions asked.
Interview Questions: Are you available to work at (insert day or time here)?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Received a call from the department secretary for an interview. Had initial interview on-site. Discussed my previous research and approach to research. Received a call two weeks later from PI offering me the job. Met with department head who did not seem too excited about hiring me but went along with his colleague anyway
Interview Questions: Isn't this place beneath your talent?

title: Compliance Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview was scheduled quickly (within two weeks of applying) however the employment process is long, about four weeks. Two one on one interviews over 2 week period and then about another two to three weeks to be notified of hire and start training. The process was so long because HR at FIU is super slow in processing.
Interview Questions: how do you manage deadlines?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and sent my resume to the head of the department at the school.  I received a call to schedule an interview about 2.5 weeks after applying.  I was told to be there on a certain day at a certain time.  It was clearly not flexible at all but luckily it worked out.  They kindly emailed me all applicable information regarding location, parking and names and title of the person who I would be meeting with.  I found out a couple days beforehand that it was a panel interview with 3 executives.  They gave me their names and titles.  The interview was very standard with them telling me about the position and asking me questions.  I got an email about a week later for a second interview.  Again, the time was given to me, not flexible.  They again provided the names and titles of those who I would be meeting with.  In this one, they put a lot of pressure on me.  It wasn't hard but it did scare me about the job quite a bit.  About a week later, I got a call with a verbal offer.  The written offer did not come until over a week later and it was a very general offer letter they basically just change the name, title and salary on and give out to everyone.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Immigrant Childen's Justice Clinic Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Direct and intelligent questions that are pertinent to the job at hand (representing clients in court). Honest answers from the interviewer when questioned about their expectations. I accepted the offer, and everything was exactly as it was described during the interview. It was a pleasant interview, and an even more pleasant of a working environment.
Interview Questions: How will you handle a difficult client?

title: Ops Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview about 1 month after applying. It was a panel interview with all my future managers. They all took turns asking me questions regarding different aspects of the job and my experience.
Interview Questions: What were my goals? If offered the position, how would I make a difference

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was subsequently called to gauge my availability and suitability for the position. The call was administered by a panel of three interviewers, all of which were very friendly. It consisted of questions regarding my schedule, my schooling and my interest in the position. It was an IT intensive position seeing as I would be trouble-shooting for students, and they asked me for any background in computers or technology that I had. The interview went by smoothly, and I was contacted again to go see them in person for the final job offer. Unfortunately, the job posting hadn't specified where the position was located. Seeing as I had just begun driving, it was rather inconvenient and difficult for me to go to work there and I had to decline the offer.
Interview Questions: What would qualify you for a position in IT if you have held no IT positions in the past?

title: Director of Membership and Development - Jewish Museum of Florida - FIU Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami Beach, FL) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was hired before the Museum Board voted to gift the Museum to FIU - game-changer and created confusion and hostility internally. Museum was unwilling to adapt to FIU policies and procedures, yet they courted the merger.
Interview Questions: None - typical questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, easy going professor. If you have the knowledge in this area, they will give you an offer. They prefer people with EE background. Also, Toful and GRE scores are important.
Interview Questions: What have you done in Smart Grid.

title: Assistant Director, Benefits Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview, Executive interview, job offer, full background check (criminal, education, employment, references)
Interview Questions: A lot of situational questions

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida International University in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Spoke over the phone with office manager to set up one on one interview went in the next day was told about the job and told when I would start no true interview questions were asked. Be polite and respectful and you will be fine.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I answered a few questions first.  Then I was asked to  teach a "lesson" of my choice (web design) to the panel over the phone who were at various campuses.  We could not see each other, just hear each other.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to be an instructional designer?

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process to become a math or physics learning assistant was very laid back and casual.  Primarily they are looking for future teachers, though any student who knows the subject and is personable will do fine in the interview.  There is an online application, though it helps to be referred by a current learning assistant and personally know those that run the program.
Interview Questions: Do you plan to become a teacher?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was accepted after an email interview. The advisor was interested in my resume and wanted be to be part of their lab. After accepting I went to campus for the day and met the lab members.
Interview Questions: What my plans were for research.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very short and to the point. I met with about 5 people, including 3 other assistants. I don't think I was in the office for more the thirty minutes. It was very conversational and just questions about my previous job experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at FIU?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: First round was a phone interview. Second round was 4 individual interviews. Third round was a panel interview with 4 directors.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: The process was not too lengthy as the Director rushed the process.  The hiring process went smoothly.
Interview Questions: What are your faults?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a CV and research statement via email.  I was not initially considered for the position, but about 5 months later I was contacted when the job search had not produced a successful candidate.  I was flown in for a full day interview, where I gave a talk about my research and met with my supervisor and coworkers.  The following day I received an offer.
Interview Questions: All questions were expected - nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida International University (Miami, FL) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: FIU placed advertisement on several websites on  the internet. Then they collect applications, send interview invitation to those qualified candidates. They come onsite for a one day interview; talking to HR, future boss, some other people. During the process, you also get chance to talk about your salary. They will offer you if they decided you are OK by a official letter.
Interview Questions: None
